title: >>> A KNIGHT'S Tale
body_text:
WALL vs. ALL
The infinite confidence and arrogance oozed out of Team ALL from the moment the "visitors" stepped onto the court. Team WALL showed up alright, but with a mere four participants!
Facing insurmountable odds during the kick-off game, cigar-smoking Jack Mess, giant killer Melissa Kerr, powerhouse Kevin Fitzpatrick, and the ultra-intense Sara DeCuir represented WALL to the best of their abilities. But come on, against the likes of Manasquan's Kevin Megill, Ocean Township's Mike Edwards, Neptune's Mike Butler, Monmouth Regional's John Tronolone, among a slew of other established veterans, WALL would go down in a heartbeat. Team ALL was on top of the mountain and nothing would knock them off. That was of course until reinforcements marched in.
The predictable outcome transitioned into, well, "Things don't look so good". The late arrivals of the Adams brothers lit a fire under the asses of their fellow soldiers regardless of the outnumbering and overpowering opposition. Along with respected veteran and icon Justin Pierce and of course the seemingly invincible Sascha Basista, man, the competition was as fierce as can be, ranking as good as any past event.
Games lasted a good twenty to thirty minutes each. But it was the end result that mattered, and somehow, someway, WALL raised the figurative trophy high and proud signaling the destruction of Team ALL. And who would have thought that a "10 vs. 17" would have concluded of the way it did.
A true "Knight's Tale" - Team WALL defeated Team ALL 3 to 2 in one of the most emotionally charged events ever witnessed. Both teams are praised for their fearless efforts, laying it all on the line in this blockbuster.
The YEARBOOK
Team ALL consisted of players from not just various parts of the county, but the state as well. Manasquan, Monmouth Regional, Ocean Township, Neptune, Marlboro, Allentown, and even South Plainfield came together in attempt to overcome Wall Township.
RECORDS
> Attendance: 27
> Notable Returns: Jack Mess (Last appearance at DODGEBALL SIXTY-IX); Tom Holowka (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LXXXI)
> New Players: (5) Chris Grasso, Austin Gelfman, Tom Pheasant, Eric Tal, Quatryle Johnson
- DODGEBALL 93 was the inaugural event of the 2007 Summer season.
- The red and blue
Letsche Rims
were used for yet another time.
- DODGEBALL 93 is one of the few events to exclude a traditional captains match of any kind (a first since DODGEBALL 73). Teams were formed based on the high school in which players attend/attended, billed as
WALL vs. ALL
.
________________________________________
_____________________
DODGEBALL 100 Captains Drawing
Congratulations to Wall's own
Kevin Fitzpatrick
, becoming the third of six captains at the big dance, DODGEBALL 100.
________________________________________
_____________________
DODGEBALL 94
Sascha Basista
and
Ray Marzarella
meet in their long-awaited rematch from DODGEBALL 84.
DODGEBALL 95
These two are f*ckin' beasts!
Kevin Megill
takes on the undefeated
Mike Edwards
in the classic return match from DODGEBALL 80.
DODGEBALL 96
Don't worry, match in the works!
DODGEBALL 97
WALL vs. ALL 2
... Will
WALL
bring the pain for a second time? Can
ALL
rebound after this crushing defeat? Get ready, because it's on again July 21.
DODGEBALL 98
Don't worry, match in the works!
DODGEBALL 99
An inter-gender clash of Season 1 icons, one day shy of their birthdays!
Alison Bertsch
one on one with
Tom Adams
!
DODGEBALL 100
Destiny. August 18. Justin Pierce, Kevin Adams, and Kevin Fitzpatrick in the summer spotlight ... who else will join them?
body_html:
WALL vs. ALL
The infinite confidence and arrogance oozed out of Team ALL from the moment the "visitors" stepped onto the court. Team WALL showed up alright, but with a mere four participants!

Facing insurmountable odds during the kick-off game, cigar-smoking Jack Mess, giant killer Melissa Kerr, powerhouse Kevin Fitzpatrick, and the ultra-intense Sara DeCuir represented WALL to the best of their abilities. But come on, against the likes of Manasquan's Kevin Megill, Ocean Township's Mike Edwards, Neptune's Mike Butler, Monmouth Regional's John Tronolone, among a slew of other established veterans, WALL would go down in a heartbeat. Team ALL was on top of the mountain and nothing would knock them off. That was of course until reinforcements marched in.

The predictable outcome transitioned into, well, "Things don't look so good". The late arrivals of the Adams brothers lit a fire under the asses of their fellow soldiers regardless of the outnumbering and overpowering opposition. Along with respected veteran and icon Justin Pierce and of course the seemingly invincible Sascha Basista, man, the competition was as fierce as can be, ranking as good as any past event.

Games lasted a good twenty to thirty minutes each. But it was the end result that mattered, and somehow, someway, WALL raised the figurative trophy high and proud signaling the destruction of Team ALL. And who would have thought that a "10 vs. 17" would have concluded of the way it did.

A true "Knight's Tale" - Team WALL defeated Team ALL 3 to 2 in one of the most emotionally charged events ever witnessed. Both teams are praised for their fearless efforts, laying it all on the line in this blockbuster.

The YEARBOOK
Team ALL consisted of players from not just various parts of the county, but the state as well. Manasquan, Monmouth Regional, Ocean Township, Neptune, Marlboro, Allentown, and even South Plainfield came together in attempt to overcome Wall Township.

RECORDS
> Attendance: 27
> Notable Returns: Jack Mess (Last appearance at DODGEBALL SIXTY-IX); Tom Holowka (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LXXXI)
> New Players: (5) Chris Grasso, Austin Gelfman, Tom Pheasant, Eric Tal, Quatryle Johnson

- DODGEBALL 93 was the inaugural event of the 2007 Summer season.
- The red and blue Letsche Rims were used for yet another time.
- DODGEBALL 93 is one of the few events to exclude a traditional captains match of any kind (a first since DODGEBALL 73). Teams were formed based on the high school in which players attend/attended, billed as WALL vs. ALL.
_____________________________________________________________

DODGEBALL 100 Captains Drawing
Congratulations to Wall's own Kevin Fitzpatrick, becoming the third of six captains at the big dance, DODGEBALL 100.
_____________________________________________________________

DODGEBALL 94
Sascha Basista and Ray Marzarella meet in their long-awaited rematch from DODGEBALL 84.

DODGEBALL 95
These two are f*ckin' beasts! Kevin Megill takes on the undefeated Mike Edwards in the classic return match from DODGEBALL 80.

DODGEBALL 96
Don't worry, match in the works!

DODGEBALL 97
WALL vs. ALL 2 ... Will WALL bring the pain for a second time? Can ALL rebound after this crushing defeat? Get ready, because it's on again July 21.

DODGEBALL 98
Don't worry, match in the works!

DODGEBALL 99
An inter-gender clash of Season 1 icons, one day shy of their birthdays! Alison Bertsch one on one with Tom Adams!

DODGEBALL 100
Destiny. August 18. Justin Pierce, Kevin Adams, and Kevin Fitzpatrick in the summer spotlight ... who else will join them?
